name: Power Throw Challenge
clue: Find the place where the sun makes the swings warm — near the climbing structure or safe open edge.
riddle:
A fiery Pokémon loves to train,
Where kids climb high and swing again.
Where ladders, bars, and slides all stay,
That's where today's big battle will play!
setup: Pokémon cutout/foam board, large velcro/sticky target area (big enough to hit), 3–4 soft Poké tennis balls.
howToPlay: Team needs 3 total hits to win.
reset: Pick up balls, confirm target is upright.
parentTip: Make target generous — success early keeps momentum high.
findCodePoem:
You've trained hard and thrown with might,
But the code is hiding out of sight!
Look where your Poké Balls came to rest,
Something nearby hides the final test!
findCodeParentHint: Look on the back of the target board.

name: Water Transfer Relay
clue: I splash where the water meets the rocks — find the safe area near the water feature.
riddle:
Some Pokémon splash and swim,
With fins and tails that help them win.
Find the place where water flows,
And tiny waves tickle your toes!
setup: Option A (Water): 1 bucket filled with water + 1 empty bucket, 1 cup per kid, mark a fill line on the empty bucket. Option B (No Water): Use blue balls/bean bags moved bucket-to-bucket.
howToPlay: One at a time, they scoop/transfer and run it to the empty bucket.
Keep going until the empty bucket reaches the fill line (or transfers all balls).
winCondition: Bucket reaches the fill line (or transfers all balls)
parentTip: Stay a safe distance from slippery edges.
findCodePoem:
Splash and pour, you did your part,
But finding the code is the smartest art!
Where the water once was deep,
Flip it over — the secret you'll keep!

name: Leaf Path Balance
clue: Find the shaded trees where the leaf pads create a path across the grass.
riddle:
Grass Pokémon love the shade,
Where leafy homes and roots are made.
Beneath tall trees where branches sway,
A forest challenge waits today!
setup: 8–12 foam pads/paper plates as leaf pads, placed across the grass to create a path.
howToPlay: Kids must cross from start to finish stepping only on pads.
If someone steps off, team restarts (keep it playful).
findCodePoem:
You crossed the forest safe and sound,
Now the code must still be found!
Look for a leaf that doesn't belong,
A forest secret won't hide long!
findCodeParentHint: Fake paper leaf hanging from nearby tree - Kids might need to look up.

name: Electric Freeze Dash
clue: Find the wide open space where you can dance and freeze when the music stops!
riddle:
When lightning sparks and thunder booms,
Electric Pokémon zoom and zoom!
Find the place that's wide and free,
With room to dance like Pikachu and me!
howToPlay: Start music: kids dance/run inside the boundary.
Pause music and call ZAP! — everyone freezes.
Anyone moving does 3 jumping jacks, then keep going.
findCodePoem:
You froze like lightning — quick and bright!
But the code is still out of sight!
Where the music made you move your feet,
Look underneath for your electric treat!

Where does Pikachu like to live?

name: Memory Match Battle
clue: Find the bench, picnic table, or pavilion edge where the cards are waiting.
riddle:
Some Pokémon are calm and wise,
They think before they strategize.
Find a place where people sit,
A quiet spot to use your wit!
setup: 8 Pokémon cards face down, 4 matching pairs.
howToPlay: Kids take turns flipping two cards.
Keep matches; missed matches flip back.
Finish when all pairs are found.
reset: Shuffle and lay face down again
findCodePoem:
You matched them all with brainy might,
Now search nearby — but keep it tight!
Where thinkers sit and puzzles are played,
The final numbers have been laid!
